description.short_desc: Driver Commands for the Cycle, Suite, and Step drivers

detailed_desc.p: This keyword library provides Driver Commands that can be used by all three DDE Drivers--CycleDriver, SuiteDriver, and StepDriver. That means they can be used in any keyword driven test tables regardless of the test tables level--Cycle, Suite, or Step.
Each different driver command has different parameters as described in its documentation. For reference, the first fields of ALL Driver Command test records are defined below:

dl.dt: The "C" = DRIVER COMMAND record type specifier.

detailed_desc.p: Driver Command parameters must be placed in the test record in the field position specified in the documentation. Some parameters are optional. However, the field associated with that parameter must be honored. If you wish to skip an optional parameter you must still provide an empty field for that parameter.
The above example shows two optional fields after NOTEPAD.EXE which are given no value(skipped).
Note that the full availablility of all Driver Commands is now spread across several files. Together, all of these files provide all the Driver Commands available to the core framework.

dl.dt: Commands focused on logging test execution.
Commands focused on Error Recovery and Flow Control.
Commands that are still provided for backward compatibility, but are no longer supported.
Commands focused on debugging test execution.

description.short_desc: Create a new private counter or start an existing stopped private counter.

detailed_desc.p: If counterID is not already an active private counter, then this routine will create a new private counter with the provided counterID as its name. The counter will be enabled for counting of all status information at all test levels.
If counterID identifies an existing counter, then this routine will enable the counter to resume counting--assuming it was stopped.
See ApplicationUtilities for more information on private counters.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify this private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: Any additional information such as the purpose of the counter.
Create and/or (re)start a counter called "TestCase 124".
description.detailed_desc: If the counter does not exist, create it and begin counting all status information. If the counter already exists, enable the counter to resume counting. This latter assumes the counter was previously stopped.

description.short_desc: Create a new private counter or suspend counts in an existing private counter.

detailed_desc.p: If counterID is not already an active private counter, then this routine will create a new private counter with the provided counterID as its name. The counter will be enabled for counting of all status information at all test levels but will be suspended from actually counting.
If counterID identifies an existing counter, then this routine will suspend counting within this counter.
See ApplicationUtilities for more information on private counters.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify this private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: Any additional information for stopping this counter.
Create and/or suspend counts on a counter called "TestCase 124".
description.detailed_desc: If the counter does not exist, create it and enable counting all status information but suspend all counting. If the counter already exists, suspend counting within it.

description.short_desc: Create a new private counter or reset counts in an existing private counter.

detailed_desc.p: If counterID is not already an active private counter, then this routine will create a new private counter with the provided counterID as its name. The counter will be enabled for counting of all status information at all test levels.
If counterID identifies an existing counter, then this routine will reset all its counts to zero(0).
See ApplicationUtilities for more information on private counters.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify this private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: Any additional information for resetting this counter.

example.usage: C, ResetCounter, "TestCase 124", "Zero all counts to retest"

description.short_desc: Create and/or reset counts on a counter called "TestCase 124".
description.detailed_desc: If the counter does not exist, create it and enable counting all status information. If the counter already exists, reset counts to zero(0).

description.short_desc: Delete any existing private counter with the provided counterID.
description.detailed_desc:
If counterID identifies an existing counter, then delete it.
See ApplicationUtilities for more information on private counters.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify this private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: Any additional information for deleting this counter.
Delete the private counter called "TestCase 124".
Store the current values of the named counter into unique DDVariables.
description.detailed_desc:
This enables the framework, scripts, and other applications to retrieve the values of these counters at runtime.
Consult ApplicationUtilities and Using DDVariables for more information on referencing these DDVariables in your tests. You must adhere to DDVariable naming conventions when providing this DDVariable basename. Note that no spaces are allowed in DDVariable names.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify the private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: The unique DDVariable prefix to use for storing counter values.
description.detailed_desc:
The DDVariable prefix will be used to create several DDVariables that will hold the counter information. The variables stored:
VARPREFIX.successes
VARPREFIX.warnings
VARPREFIX.general_failures
VARPREFIX.test_passes
VARPREFIX.test_warnings
VARPREFIX.test_failures
VARPREFIX.test_records
VARPREFIX.total_records
VARPREFIX.IO_failures
VARPREFIX.skipped_records
VARPREFIX.filename
VARPREFIX.id
VARPREFIX.mode
VARPREFIX.suspended
Consult ApplicationUtilities and Using DDVariables for more information on referencing these DDVariables in your tests. You must adhere to DDVariable naming conventions when providing this DDVariable basename. Note that no spaces are allowed in DDVariable names.

description.short_desc: Store counter "TestCase 124" counts into several DDVariables prefixed with "TestCase124".
description.detailed_desc: Consult ApplicationUtilities and Using DDVariables for more information on referencing these DDVariables in your tests. You must adhere to DDVariable naming conventions when providing this DDVariable basename. Note that no spaces are allowed in DDVariable names.

description.short_desc: Log the specified counter's info in the active log(s) of the current Log Facility.
description.detailed_desc: Extracts a snapshot of the specified private counter and outputs a small, embedded Status Report in the active logs of the current Log Facility. The Status Report will be identified by the name of the private counter. (Future) We will allow you to optionally specify a different Log Facility by name.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify this private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: (Future) The name of a Log Facility other than the "current" one.
description.detailed_desc: When suppport for named Log Facilities is provided you will be able to specify which of these you wish to receive the Status Report.

description.short_desc: Create a Status Report section in active logs of the current Log Facility.
description.detailed_desc: This Status Report will be identified by the name of the private counter.

description.short_desc: Create a new private counter or modify the mode of an existing private counter.

detailed_desc.p: If counterID is not already an active private counter, then this routine will create a new private counter with the provided counterID and counting mode.
If counterID identifies an existing counter, then this routine will modify the counting mode of the existing counter.
See AUSetStatusCounterMode for more information on private counters.

description.short_desc: The unique name used to identify this private counter.
description.detailed_desc: These unique names are case-insensitive.

description.short_desc: The counting mode to use for the specified counter.
description.detailed_desc:
Currently supported modes are:
"AllStatusInfo" or "1"
"StepTestsOnly" or "2"
Consult AUSetStatusCounterMode for more information on private counters.

description.short_desc: Create a new counter with the mode or modify the mode of an existing counter.
description.detailed_desc: The "TestCase 124" counter will be created and/or modified to use the "StepTestsOnly" counting mode.

description.short_desc: Create a new counter with the mode or modify the mode of an existing counter.
description.detailed_desc: The "TestCase 124" counter will be created and/or modified to use the "StepTestsOnly" counting mode.

description.short_desc: Suspend counting on ALL status counters--both public/global and private.
description.detailed_desc:
Suspends all status counting that is triggered via ApplicationUtilities.
See ApplicationUtilities for more information on counters.

description.short_desc: Any additional information for suspending status counts.
(Future) The name of a Log Facility other than the "current" one.
description.detailed_desc: When suppport for named Log Facilities is provided you will be able to specify which of these you wish to receive the notice.

description.short_desc: Suspend all status counting--public and private.
Resume counting on ALL status counters--both public/global and private.
description.detailed_desc:
Resume all status counting that is triggered via ApplicationUtilities. Only counters that are enabled--not independently "stopped"--will resume counting. Stopped counters are still stopped.
See ApplicationUtilities for more information on counters.

description.short_desc: Any additional information for resuming status counts.
(Future) The name of a Log Facility other than the "current" one.
description.detailed_desc: When suppport for named Log Facilities is provided you will be able to specify which of these you wish to receive the notice.

description.short_desc: Suspend all status counting--public and private.
Begin tracking status on a user-defined TestCase.
description.detailed_desc: Log/process the beginning of testing associated with a user-defined Testcase. A private counter will keep track of status for the testcase.

description.short_desc: The user-defined ID of the Testcase.
A description of the Testcase
Logs the start of a testcase with an ID of Option1.
description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also started.

description.short_desc: Logs the start of a testcase with an ID of Option1.
description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also started.

description.short_desc: Stop tracking status on a user-defined TestCase.
description.detailed_desc: Log/process the end of testing associated with a user-defined Testcase. A private counter will keep track of status for the testcase.

description.short_desc: The user-defined ID of the Testcase.
A description of the Testcase
Logs the end of a testcase with an ID of Option1.
description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also stopped.

description.short_desc: Logs the end of a testcase with an ID of Option1.
description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also stopped.

description.detailed_desc: Log/process the beginning of testing associated with this user-defined item. A private counter will keep track of status for the item.

description.short_desc: The user-defined ID of the item.
A description of the item.

description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also started.

description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also started.

description.detailed_desc: The private status counter is also stopped.
